Free Meals for all LASD Students

Free Breakfast and Lunch for all students

Any money in your students account will remain until charges begin again in January. Any money paid for meals beginning Aug. 31 will be credited to your accounts.
Distance learning students are eligible for daily hot lunch meals or a possible alternative weekly meal plan separate from the hot lunch menu. Please contact the school to request.
Daren Christianson, Supt.

As I write this weeks update I am reminded of the movie "Groundhogs Day". We are still learning, growing and developing with our distance learning model. I cannot stress strongly enough how important it is for parents to reach out to their child's teacher if there are issues. We just learned something interesting. We have received a few calls of people not receiving their mailers with the 12-digit code.

Those mailers are being sent from several different census centers. Some of these are in states with stay-at-home/shutdown orders. So some packets did not get sent. Each geographic area is sent a different center. For example Langdon residents received their survey packets (unless they use a PO Box). We have heard many Munich residents did not or received mailers very late. The census bureau thinks the Munich mailers were likely supposed to be sent by one of the centers that shut down. So we really need to push the message to respond online without the packet.

Please pass the word. Accurate completion of census impacts federal programs and dollars.
Daren

COVID-19
I am monitoring the situation with the COVID-19 virus and associated issues. We are taking direct guidance from the governor and ND health department. Things appear to change hourly. It is vitally important that if your child is sick that you keep them home. Public school systems do not currently have the authority to offer online or off campus curriculum and count this as contact days for our students. Current guidance states that missed time must be made up in the following ways.
Making up the hours on planned Professional Development (PD) days, if the mandatory three PD days are already met;
Making up school time on Saturdays;
Extending the school day; or
Extending the school year.
If public schools are afforded the flexibility to offer content differently and the situation dictates that we do not hold school those avenues will be pursued.
Daren Christianson
